item.title: Rochester Review Master Class: Revisited
item.description: TL;DNR In the early days of software, having a product that worked was good enough. Nowadays design is the differentiator. There are multiple factors to a good design: learnability, efficiency, flexibility, aesthetics. The study of human-centered design isn't new. The same concepts that Jakob Nielsen covered in the 1980s ring true today. In 2015, I was interviewed for the Rochester Review, my alma mater’s quarterly publication for parents and alumni.
